label: 連歌
本: Edo Culture: Daily Life and Diversions in Urban Japan, 1600-1868 . University of Hawai'i Press . 1997
説明文: Linked verse.Renga sequences were often composed by two poets alternately (or consecutively) writing 5-7-5 and 7-7 syllable links of verse and stringing them together. This form of verse can be found as early as the Heian period (794-1185) and reached its height after the fourteenth century.［平安］
